name: qicr lite IRC client beta
description: NEW:  * Optimized for Android 7.0 * Notification chat * Widgets for Android 3.0 and up! Open as many channels as you want at the same time, from the home screen, multitask with ease! (Experimental) * Android 4.1 and up: Chat without leaving your current app, choose Chat from the notification! Tons of awesome * Full message logging, searchable.  So many changes and improvements, give it a shot, this is totally worth your time!  chat about qicr on irc.freenode.net/#qicr  Please report any issues and feedback via github, IRC or email, comments are not always monitored and cannot be addressed.  Features: * Notification center, never lose messages again, drag the toolbar down to view * Input history, repeat previously entered text, press/drag the caret above the input field to view history * Nick colors (nicks are randomly assigned 1 of 18 colors to easily follow conversations) * Unified, Material Design on Android 2.3 and up * Lag timer * Configurable tri-mode channel navigation: swipe between all channels no matter the mode, choice of tabbed UI, or drawer menu that slides in from the left. * CTCP commands, including /ping * SSL support * BNC support (znc tested) * Raw command support (/raw) * Multiple-servers single-view * Swipe and tab between channels * Full nick completion, tab-key or left-most icon * Full external keyboard support on Android 3.0+ (ALT-1 through ALT-0 and ALT-Q through ALT-P = Tabs 1 through 20; CTRL-TAB and CTRL-SHIFT-TAB = forward and back tabs) * /help for a list of implemented commands * Speech recognition support, press the button and end a sentence with over to automatically send. Say clear line to erase the text area. * Message notifications * Monospaced font (DejaVuSansMono for pre-ICS) for proper text alignment. * Configurable fonts and text sizes * Configurable nick colors  Future features: * Last read line marker * Zebra-striping messages * Configurable command char (default /) * Scripting support (javascript or lua; depending on demand) * More /commands (/topic, /kick, /mode, etc.) * irc:// URL protocol support (depending on demand) * Implement android.app.backup.BackupAgent support * DCC support, depending on demand  Trivia: * Scala, not Java * Open Source: https://github.com/pfn/qicr
